text: Solve this problem step by step.
End with 'DONE.' when you have a solution.
Question: A man lives on the 10th floor of an apartment building.
Every morning, he takes the elevator down to the ground floor to go to work.
When he returns in the evening, he takes the elevator to the 7th floor and then walks up the stairs for the remaining three floors to his apartment.
However, on rainy days, he takes the elevator all the way to the 10th floor.

Why does he do this? 

 Solution: 
<think>
Okay, so I'm trying to figure out why this man takes the elevator all the way to the 10th floor on rainy days.
Let me break this down step by step.
First, let's understand his usual routine.
Every morning, he lives on the 10th floor and takes the elevator down to the ground floor (which is floor 1) to go to work.
In the evening, when he returns, he takes the elevator up to the 7th floor and then walks up the remaining three floors to his apartment.
So, on a typical day, he's saving himself from walking up three floors in the evening because he takes the elevator part of the way.
But on rainy days, he changes his routine.
Instead of getting off at the 7th floor, he stays on the elevator all the way to the 10th floor.

So, why would he do that on a rainy day?

Maybe it's about avoiding the rain.
If it's raining, he doesn't want to get wet.
By taking the elevator all the way to the 10th floor, he avoids walking outside in the rain.
But wait, he's already taking the elevator part of the way in the evening.
So why not just do the same on rainy days? Or maybe there's another reason.
Another possibility is that on rainy days, the elevator might be less crowded or move faster, but that doesn't seem likely.
More people might take the elevator during rain, making it slower.
So that probably isn't it.
Perhaps it's about time.
On rainy days, maybe he has more time or less time and prefers to spend it differently.
But that seems less likely because his main goal is to avoid the rain.
Wait, maybe it's about the effort of walking.
On rainy days, the stairs might be slippery, making it dangerous to walk up three floors.
So, to avoid slipping or falling, he takes the elevator all the way to the 10th floor.
That makes sense because walking up three floors in the rain could be risky.
Alternatively, maybe the elevator is more comfortable or has better lighting on rainy days, but that's a stretch.
The primary reason would be to avoid the rain.
So, putting it all together, on rainy days, he takes the elevator all the way to the 10th floor to stay dry and avoid walking in the rain.

</think>

He does this to avoid walking in the rain, thereby staying dry and preventing potential slips or falls on the stairs.
